required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Novel Non-Invasive Monitoring Parameter in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Novel Cardio-Respiratory Parameter in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to study Non-Invasive Performance evaluation of monitoring algorithm.

detailed_description.textblock: Assess equivalency, performance, and accuracy of a new monitoring algorithm in Healthy Volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Determine Respiration Rate Measured as Mean and Standard Deviation With Accuracy That is Non-inferior to Predicate Device.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants were monitorerd on average of 30 minute period
primary_outcome.description: Mean and standard deviations of respiration rates collected from healthy volunteers were compared between Covidien Respiration Rate Software, Transthoracic Impedance and Overscored End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms. Each volunteer served as its own control.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Calculate Respiration Rate With a Root Mean Square Difference (RMSD) of < 3 Breaths Per Minute Compared With a End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms, With 95% Confidence.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants were monitored on average of 30 minute periods
secondary_outcome.description: The data used for analysis consisted of multiple simultaneous measures of RR_TTI, RR_V1.0 and RR_EtCO2 for each subject. Given N sets of simultaneous RR values for each of P patients, the simultaneous RR values were used to calculate a pair of RMSD values for each subject. The two RMSD values, RMSDRR_V1.0_vs_EtCO2, and RMSDTTI_vs_EtCO2, quantify the mean absolute difference in simultaneous estimates of respiratory rate between RR_V1.0 compared with RR_EtCO2 and RR_TTI compared with RR_EtCO2, respectively for the subjects with 95% confidence of mean ± 3.38 BrPM. The Measure type is Number and represents the RMSD of Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is 18 or older
- Subject is willing and able to provide written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe contact allergies to standard adhesive materials
- Subjects with abnormalities that may prevent proper application of the device
- Women who are pregnant or lactating
- Subjects with significant Arrhythmias

group.title: Respiration Rate in Healthy Volunteers
group.description: Healthy volunteer participants were monitored for 30 minute period to collect respiratory rate information from non-invasive sensors. Covidien Respiration Rate, Transthoracic Impedance and Overscored Endtidal Carbon Dioxide.

outcome.title: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Determine Respiration Rate Measured as Mean and Standard Deviation With Accuracy That is Non-inferior to Predicate Device.
outcome.description: Mean and standard deviations of respiration rates collected from healthy volunteers were compared between Covidien Respiration Rate Software, Transthoracic Impedance and Overscored End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms. Each volunteer served as its own control.
outcome.time_frame: Participants were monitorerd on average of 30 minute period
outcome.population: One participant was excluded from the analysis based on cardiac arrhythmia

group.title: Respiration Rate From Covidien Respiration Rate Software
group.description: Respiration Rate determined by novel plethysmographic analysis

group.title: Respiration Rate From Endtidal Carbon Dioxide
group.description: Respiration Rate determined by manual overscoring of capnography waveforms.

group.title: Respiration Rate From Transthoracic Impedance
group.description: Respiration Rate determined by Transthoracic Impedance

measure.title: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Determine Respiration Rate Measured as Mean and Standard Deviation With Accuracy That is Non-inferior to Predicate Device.
measure.description: Mean and standard deviations of respiration rates collected from healthy volunteers were compared between Covidien Respiration Rate Software, Transthoracic Impedance and Overscored End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms. Each volunteer served as its own control.
measure.population: One participant was excluded from the analysis based on cardiac arrhythmia

outcome.title: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Calculate Respiration Rate With a Root Mean Square Difference (RMSD) of < 3 Breaths Per Minute Compared With a End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms, With 95% Confidence.
outcome.description: The data used for analysis consisted of multiple simultaneous measures of RR_TTI, RR_V1.0 and RR_EtCO2 for each subject. Given N sets of simultaneous RR values for each of P patients, the simultaneous RR values were used to calculate a pair of RMSD values for each subject. The two RMSD values, RMSDRR_V1.0_vs_EtCO2, and RMSDTTI_vs_EtCO2, quantify the mean absolute difference in simultaneous estimates of respiratory rate between RR_V1.0 compared with RR_EtCO2 and RR_TTI compared with RR_EtCO2, respectively for the subjects with 95% confidence of mean ± 3.38 BrPM. The Measure type is Number and represents the RMSD of Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software
outcome.time_frame: Participants were monitored on average of 30 minute periods
outcome.population: One participant was excluded from the data analysis based on cardiac arrhythmia

group.title: Healthy Volunteers
group.description: Covidien Respiration Rate, Transthoracic Impedance and Overscored Endtidal Carbon Dioxide derived respiration rates were recorded on all the volunteers simultaneously.

measure.title: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Calculate Respiration Rate With a Root Mean Square Difference (RMSD) of < 3 Breaths Per Minute Compared With a End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms, With 95% Confidence.
measure.description: The data used for analysis consisted of multiple simultaneous measures of RR_TTI, RR_V1.0 and RR_EtCO2 for each subject. Given N sets of simultaneous RR values for each of P patients, the simultaneous RR values were used to calculate a pair of RMSD values for each subject. The two RMSD values, RMSDRR_V1.0_vs_EtCO2, and RMSDTTI_vs_EtCO2, quantify the mean absolute difference in simultaneous estimates of respiratory rate between RR_V1.0 compared with RR_EtCO2 and RR_TTI compared with RR_EtCO2, respectively for the subjects with 95% confidence of mean ± 3.38 BrPM. The Measure type is Number and represents the RMSD of Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software
measure.population: One participant was excluded from the data analysis based on cardiac arrhythmia

outcome.title: Calculate Covidien Respiration Rate Software Accuracy as Mean Error +/- Standard Deviation
outcome.description: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software shall calculate respiration rate as mean error of +/- standard deviation.
outcome.population: One participant was excluded from the data analysis based on cardiac arrhythmia

group.title: Healthy Volunteers
group.description: Covidien Respiration Rate, Transthoracic Impedance and Overscored Endtidal Carbon Dioxide.

measure.title: Calculate Covidien Respiration Rate Software Accuracy as Mean Error +/- Standard Deviation
measure.description: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software shall calculate respiration rate as mean error of +/- standard deviation.
measure.population: One participant was excluded from the data analysis based on cardiac arrhythmia

group.title: Healthy Volunteers
group.description: A selection of subjects from the general population from ages 18 - 50.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Ulf Borg, Director of Clinical Affairs
